structure.unit: STATE LIBRARIES -- LIBRARIANS -- STATE ARCHIVES AND RECORDS

law.text: When the Governor, Lieutenant Governor, or any state agency or subdivision or the principal officer thereof shall reproduce and preserve for record any records or papers by photographic, microphotographic, nonerasable optical image, or other process which accurately reproduces the original records, which forms a durable medium, and which is performed in accordance with rules and regulations promulgated by the department, the original may be disposed of or destroyed.
law.history: Amended 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 37, sec. 1, effective July 13, 1990; and ch. 88, secs. 82 and 93, effective July 1, 1992. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 223, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1986. -- Amended 1970 Ky. Acts ch. 92, sec. 51. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 49, sec. 26, effective June 19, 1958.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/13/90). This section was amended by two 1990 Acts which do not appear to be in conflict and have been compiled together.
metadata.note: Amendment of this section by 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 88, secs. 82 and 93 became effective July 1, 1992, in compliance with 1992 Ky. Acts ch. 324, sec. 30.
